bill_title: require school districts to provide special education or special education and related services to resident students receiving alternative instruction.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require school districts to provide special education or special education and related services to resident students receiving alternative instruction. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-37-1.1 be amended to read as follows: 13-37-1.1. The South Dakota Board of Education may adopt rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, governing standards for educational and noneducational programs, public and nonpublic, serving children in need of special education or special education and related services and children, ages birth through two, with developmental delays and severe disabilities; appeal procedures for disputes involving the placement or program of such children; and administration, funding and personnel associated with special education or special education and related services. No school district may deny special education or special education and related services to any resident child who is determined to be in need of special education or special education and related services and who is receiving alternate instruction pursuant to § 13-27-3. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
